intro: Euphrasia × brevipila subsp. tenuis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved eyebright, is a hybrid species within the genus Euphrasia, which belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae. It is characterized by its small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, typically from March to May, and its slender, hairy stems. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are usually less than 1 cm in length, giving it its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Euphrasia × brevipila subsp. tenuis is often found in the British Isles and is considered a rare and localized species.
